bibl.title: Letter from Elihu Root to William Osler, May 20, 1902

div1.p: Root thanks Osler for his letter supporting Reed for nomination to the post of Surgeon General. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Elihu Root to William Osler, May 20, 1902
div1.opener:
Reed
War Dept.
Washington May 20, 1902.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of May 4th,
in behalf of the appointment of Major Walter
Reed, Surgeon, U. S. Army, as Surgeon General of
the Army upon the retirement of the present in-
cumbent. The matter will receive the full consider-
ation to which your eminent services to science
entitle it. Of course capacity for administra-
tion and qualities quite apart from scientific
attainments will have an important bearing upon
the decision.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Elihu Root Secretary of War.
Professor William Osler,
Johns-Hopkins University,
Baltimore, Md.
